business_idea: Source-level data observability and compliance platform that delivers real-time data visibility, classification, lineage tracking, and policy enforcement — embedding continuous governance directly into the software development lifecycle without disrupting developer workflows.
founder_summary: Three co-founders — David Scott Turner (CEO), Carl Strempel, and Bruno Soares — who previously co-founded Imburse Payments, a global enterprise payments platform acquired by Duck Creek Technologies (US insurance software provider). Decades of combined experience building secure, compliant systems in regulated industries.

founders.name: David Scott Turner
founders.background: Previously co-founded Imburse Payments (acquired by Duck Creek Technologies). Experience in regulated industries and enterprise payments.

founders.name: Carl Strempel
founders.background: Previously CFO & Co-Founder at Imburse Payments (acquired by Duck Creek Technologies).

founders.name: Bruno Soares
founders.background: Previously Chief Product Officer. Co-founded Imburse Payments (acquired by Duck Creek Technologies).

product_status.biggest_product_gap: No public signup or self-serve; demo/book-a-demo CTA only — suggests product is in controlled early access or pre-GA
ux_observations: CTAs are 'See Qala in Action' and 'Book a demo' — no self-serve
Claims 'Up and running in under 30 minutes'
Built-in enforcement for GDPR, DORA, EU AI Act, SOC2, ISO 27001, PCI DSS
product_status.pricing_model: Transparent pricing claimed ('Predictable costs with no hidden fees - try before you buy') but no public pricing page found

primary_icp: Engineering teams, compliance teams, CISOs, and security officers at scale-ups, fintechs, SaaS companies, and SMEs operating in regulated industries who need real-time data visibility and continuous compliance
pain_points: Data landscape is a black box — teams can't map the full extent of their data
Compliance is reactive — scrambling to patch gaps before audits
Manual evaluations become outdated by the time they're completed
Engineering and compliance teams lose time piecing together data flow pictures
Lack of real-time clarity creates security risks and slows compliance with GDPR, DORA, EU AI Act
Existing tools provide periodic snapshots, not continuous monitoring
industry: Data Governance / Data Observability / Compliance Infrastructure

competitors.name: Collibra
competitors.notes: Traditional data governance platform; periodic snapshots not real-time

competitors.name: Alation
competitors.notes: Data intelligence platform; mentioned as traditional competitor

competitors.name: Immuta
competitors.notes: Mentioned directly as traditional competitor in TechFundingNews article

competitors.name: BigID
competitors.notes: Data intelligence for privacy, security, and governance

competitors.name: OneTrust
competitors.notes: Trust intelligence platform; privacy and compliance

competitors.name: Monte Carlo
competitors.notes: Data observability focused on data quality/reliability rather than compliance

competitive_positioning: Qala differentiates by embedding governance at the source (code, APIs, pipelines) for continuous real-time compliance, vs traditional tools that provide periodic snapshots and sit at the edge. 'Shift-left' model for data compliance. Only Swiss startup in the European data governance wave.
key_features: Live data mapping — real-time mapping of data flows and topologies
Data lineage — trace origins to downstream systems

persona.role: CISO / Head of Compliance / CTO at regulated scale-up or fintech
persona.company_size: Scale-ups and SMEs in regulated industries

meta.source_detail: letsqala.com solutions pages and press coverage

problem.pain_point: Enterprises have no real-time visibility into what data they handle, where it lives, and how it flows — making compliance reactive, manual, and outdated by completion
problem.trigger_event: Failed audit, data breach scare, new regulation (DORA, EU AI Act), or scaling to new markets requiring compliance proof
problem.current_workaround: Manual data mapping, spreadsheet-based compliance tracking, periodic audits with Collibra/Alation-style tools

validation.time_to_first_value: Under 30 minutes to integrate (per website claim)

monetization.revenue_model: Unknown — 'Transparent pricing' and 'try before you buy' mentioned but no public pricing
monetization.buyer_vs_user: Buyer: CISO/VP Engineering/Head of Compliance. User: Engineering and compliance teams

identity_meta.source_detail: EU-Startups article, TechFundingNews article, Crunchbase, LinkedIn profiles
EU-Startups (Oct 29 2025), TechFundingNews, BeBeez, FoundersToday, Vestbee — all confirmed €1.7M pre-seed
Crunchbase lists 1-10; distributed across Switzerland, Portugal, UK
LinkedIn company page found (qala-technologies). No Twitter/GitHub/ProductHunt found via search.

change_log.details: Full GrowthMind Company Seed enrichment from letsqala.com website, EU-Startups, TechFundingNews, Crunchbase, LinkedIn, RocketReach. Three co-founders identified (all ex-Imburse Payments). Pre-seed funding of €1.7M confirmed from multiple sources. No public pricing, Twitter, GitHub, or Product Hunt presence found.
